page.title: 12Local History(Continued)
page.content: Place Names-MONKHOUSE-Long ago Monks walked from Abbey to Abbey.When they walked from Dieucress(Leek) to Croxden they used to rest at Monkhouse.They chose a high place so that the local people could light beacons to show the Croxden Monks that they had arrived safely.THE BIRCHES-Once Birch trees grew on what is now a modern Council Estate.MEADOW DRIVE-originally the Meadow belonged to the Hospital & a herd of cows was kept to provide for the needs of the Hospital(now in the process of being demolished & re-built).QUEEN ST was once called Gravel Pit Rd,it's name was changed when Queen Victoria came to the throne.TAPE ST.was called New St. until 1791 when J&N Philips came to the area with their looms & built a tape mill (now Kwik-Save Supermarket)
